availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Cornell (Louisville coffee house/bar owner)

body.p: Born in Kentucky. Lived in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky. Owned a coffee house/bar, named Rogers & Cornell, in Hudson Hall, Louisville.

bibl.p: Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business Firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, for 1865-6 (Louisville, KY: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, Publishers, 1865), 256.
The Louisville Courier Journal, 1 Feb 1859, 1, ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 9, p. 129.
